definition: to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: In short, the two traits go together.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，这两项特性合而为一了。

sentences.english: That’s right, it is actually a hybrid of the two.
sentences.chinese: 没错，事实上是两种方式合而为一。

sentences.english: Is about to merge with a company in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 在这歌吟之中，我将让我的生命与信仰合而为一。

sentences.english: The sea and sky seemed to blend on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 在地平线上海洋和天空似乎合而为一。

sentences.english: The Fire And The Ice Can Combine Into One ?
The two Shus combine together to shape up as a human. When the human die, they separate.
sentences.chinese: 此二叔合而为一人，当此人死后他们俩也就分开了。

sentences.english: Endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
sentences.chinese: 用和平彼此联络，竭力保守圣灵所赐合而为一的心。

sentences.english: We rejoice in the sacrament that makes Hongzhou Huang and Xiaojing Zhang one.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这个使黄鸿洲与张皛晶合而为一的圣典中欢欣。

sentences.english: In this singing, I will make my life and faith merge into one.
sentences.chinese: 在这歌吟之中，我将让我的生命与信仰合而为一。

to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms

to complement one another (idiom)
warm/agreeable
to blend/to mix
compatible/consistent/to tolerate (each other)
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to blend
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to interact/interrelated
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
very close/no gap between them/continuously/unbroken/hard to separate/indistinguishable
